title: Ultrasound Font - What Is It?
content:
I had a stillborn baby boy early this year, after moving house the scan pictures were severely damaged. I want to revive the images to the exact standard we received them for our memory book. I am having issues determining what fonts are used.

I appreciate all help and assistance greatly.

Unfortunately mine is pretty ineligible, which I am distraught about! I have included various images which aren't copyrighted which use the same font as displayed in mine as it's from the same ultrasound machine.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417102504im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FONT-1_6262.PNG)

comments.content:
Note that an ultrasound machine could use a custom OEM font which is not necessary available as a general purpose digital font. That said, you may like one of the following similar fonts:  
 **[Fox Grotesque (Alt Black)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417102504/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Various%20%2F%20TipografiaRamis%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Fox%20Grotesque%20-%20Alt%20Black&fid=f0c1787a254682249396fd45b555176d&fsize=48&text=DERFO%2019%2F06%2F2%2011%3A42%3A07&wrap=2)** [TipografiaRamis, 2012]  
 **[Merge Pro (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417102504/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Various%20%2F%20Philatype%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Merge%20Pro%20-%20Bold&fid=f2046ef44b09bb963ab97ebe1ede4b6e&fsize=48&text=DERFO%2019%2F06%2F2%2011%3A42%3A07&wrap=2)** [Philatype, 2012]
Thank-you very much for your response! The machine used for my ultrasound was a Toshiba model - not sure if that's of any assitance. I can get most letters to match up except the "R".

I think it's Arial Bold.

- Lex
Arial is close but look at R

I am sorry for your loss.

The font looks a bit like Univers (the E particularly suggests that); I think I've seen something similar to this on certain computer screens in things on TV. However, I was looking for pictures of NASA Mission Control, and didn't see anything like that there, only much smaller printing.

That the machine was from Toshiba, however, is _very_ useful information; at least a web search might turn up more images of the same kind of print, even if the font has no name.
